bibl.title: Letter from William F. Smith to Henry Rose Carter, June 21, 1905

div1.p: Smith congratulates Carter for his promotion.

div1.head: Letter from William F. Smith to Henry Rose Carter, June 21, 1905
div1.opener:
ISTHMIAN CANAL COMMISSION.
Gorgona, C. T.
June 21, 1905
Rear Admiral JOHN G. WALKER,
United States Navy, CHAIRMAN.
Major General GEORGE W. DAVIS,
United States Army.
WILLIAM BARCLAY PARSONS, C. E.
WILLIAM B. BURR, C. E.
BENJAMIN M. HARROD, C. E.
C. EWALD GRUNSKY, C. E.
MR. FRANK J. HECKER.
My dear Col. Carter,
div1.p:
The omission of the
prefix “acting” to your official name affords me
a very great pleasure, and I wish to offer you
my sincere congratulations on an event which is
of great importance to us all. I am not given to
flattery, but I can truly say that no better appoint-
ment could be made, nor one more pleasing to all
your subordinates.

Mrs. Smith joins me in good wishes, and con-
siders your good fortune as an agreeable feature in
the programme of the day on which she celebrates her
nth birthday.
